conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions committee—I'm Student_B. School_E is my first-choice school, and I’m very motivated to join your community. conversation.message:
Hi Student_B—thanks for reaching out, and we’re glad to hear School_E is your first choice.

In these rounds, we value (1) clear fit with School_E (why our programs/culture specifically), (2) consistency and follow-through (e.g., if we’re your top choice, applying when ready), and (3) a concise picture of what you’ll contribute (academics/activities/leadership/service).

To strengthen your candidacy next round, please send a brief note covering: (a) the top 1–2 reasons School_E is your best fit, (b) one achievement you’re most proud of, and (c) what you’d like to get involved in here. If you’re ready, you can submit an [APPLY] in a future round as well.

What program/club or aspect of School_E is the biggest draw for you?

We should keep Student_B engaged while waiting to see if higher-priority students (especially Student_A or Student_E, who both rank School_E relatively high at 4th/2nd respectively) reach out or apply in later rounds. Since this is only a talk round, respond with [TALK], encourage an [APPLY], and ask for info while signaling we are still considering candidates.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for the thoughtful note and for being careful not to force a decision while our policy is still to hold the seat.

On what would count as a “clear signal” that higher-priority students (Student_D, Student_E, Student_A) are no longer in play: in this process, the only truly definitive signals would be (a) they become matched elsewhere (and therefore exit the market) or (b) they explicitly indicate they will not be applying to School_C. Absent one of those, we generally cannot treat any particular round number as proof they won’t apply later.

Practically, what we do each round is:
- If a higher-priority student applies and we still have the seat, we would prioritize them.
- If no higher-priority applicants are active and we determine it is appropriate to move forward, we would then consider the next highest-priority ready-to-enroll applicant.

We will keep you flagged as an active, ready-to-accept candidate. If you would like to be eligible for an immediate offer in any round where we decide to release the hold, the key step is that you send an [APPLY] in that round (since we can only extend an [ACCEPT] in response to an [APPLY]).

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
